feed.title: BSides SF
feed.subtitle: Security B-Sides San Francisco is a two-day information security conference. It is a conference by the community for the community.

entry.title: Pre-sale tickets are sold out!
entry.content: There will still be a limited number of presale tickets available at the door for $40 so plan accordingly if you still need a ticket!
entry.summary: There will still be a limited number of presale tickets available at the door for $40 so plan accordingly if you still need a ticket!

entry.content: Thank you to Salesforce for sponsoring our Sunday night Happy Hour at DNA lounge on the 12th! See you there.

entry.title: Thank you! BSidesSF 2017 Electronic Badges are Sold Out!

link.title: Thank you! BSidesSF 2017 Electronic Badges are Sold Out!

entry.content: We were excited to be able to offer electronic badges this year and are beyond thrilled that participants felt the same and bought them all so quickly! We want to give a big thank you to VerSprite for sponsoring the electronic badge this year and can’t wait to hand them out.
entry.summary: We were excited to be able to offer electronic badges this year and are beyond thrilled that participants felt the same and bought them all so quickly! We want to give a big thank you to VerSprite for sponsoring the electronic badge this year and can’t wait to hand them out.

entry.title: BSidesSF 2017 Keynotes
entry.content:
We’re happy to introduce our two keynote speakers:

Jason Truppi, career technologist turned FBI agent and now tech entrepreneur, will be sharing illusions and realities he saw both in the field and in Silicon Valley.

Robert Wood, who runs the security and compliance teams at Nuna, will explore strategies that security teams and leaders can use to balance bureaucracy, compliance, and politics to achieve the security goals they’re striving for.

You can get more details here and here!
entry.summary: We’re happy to introduce our two keynote speakers:

entry.title: BSidesSF 2017 CTF
entry.content: That’s right, we’ll have a CTF this year! Keep an eye on the ctf page for updates as well as to participate during the event which runs Saturday, February 11 at 4pm PST, to Monday, February 13 at 4pm PST.
entry.summary: That’s right, we’ll have a CTF this year! Keep an eye on the ctf page for updates as well as to participate during the event which runs Saturday, February 11 at 4pm PST, to Monday, February 13 at 4pm PST.

entry.content:
Head over to the schedule page to see the schedule and get to know our speakers!

Spread the word!

entry.title: BSidesSF 2017 Call for Volunteers
entry.content:
Interested in helping at BSidesSF 2017?

As a community-driven event, BSidesSF would not be possible without the work of volunteers. The organizers have worked hard to build a fun and exciting agenda. In order to execute this event and make it successful, we seeking additional volunteers to help with the tasks on the two days of the event (February 12th and 13th, 2017), which include, but are not limited to:

Registration / Information Audio/Visual Room moderators / security Speaker wrangling Top secret undercover missions We understand that our volunteers want to hear some of the talks as well, and we will work with you to ensure you are able to do so.

You can sign up to be a volunteer here.

entry.title: BSidesSF 2017 CFP First Round Speakers
entry.content:
BSidesSF Round 2 submissions have closed and we are reviewing the additional submissions. The first round accepted 9 talks. Congratulations to the first round speakers!

Witchcraft Compiler Collection: Towards Programs Self Awareness by Jonathan Brossard

The Underground Economy of Apple ID by Claud Xiao

Tired of Playing Exploit Kit Whack-A-Mole? Let’s Automate by Anjum Ahuja

Assessing the Embedded Devices On Your Network by David Tomaschik

Dormant DOMination by Christian Frichot

Should I Pay or Should I Go? Game Theory and Ransomware by Tony Martin-Vegue

DNS Attacks, a History and Overview by Nick Mckenna

Security through Visibility by Katie Ledoux

Reducing “Mixtape to Master Key” Scenarios: How to Block the Dark Army from Mayhem Using API-driven Access Control by Aren Sandersen

Stay tuned for the announcement of the second round submissions!
entry.summary: BSidesSF Round 2 submissions have closed and we are reviewing the additional submissions. The first round accepted 9 talks. Congratulations to the first round speakers!

entry.title: BSidesSF 2017 Ticket Sales Opened
entry.content:
The time has come! Grab your tickets at https://bsidessf2017.eventbrite.com/. A select amount of academic/financial hardship tickets are available. New this year, we are also offering electronic badges while supplies last.

Please note: You have the option to purchase a t-shirt with your ticket, but we can only guarantee you will get your chosen size if your purchase is submitted by January 15th, 2017.

See you in February ~
entry.summary: The time has come! Grab your tickets at https://bsidessf2017.eventbrite.com/. A select amount of academic/financial hardship tickets are available. New this year, we are also offering electronic badges while supplies last.
